prompt: <description>Part 1 **Create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** 1. Draw a coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. 2. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw four lines in the following order: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.5543, 0) - Line 2: (0.5543, 0) to (0.5543, 0.75) - Line 3: (0.5543, 0.75) to (0, 0.75) - Line 4: (0, 0.75) to (0, 0) 4. Close the sketch. 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.163 units. Part 2 **Create a stepped rectangular prism based on Part 1** 1. Create a coordinate system at (0.2517, 0.0601, 0.163) with no rotation. 2. Align the new coordinate system with the first part's top surface. 3. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 4. Draw four lines in the following order: - Line 1: (0, 0) to (0.051, 0) - Line 2: (0.051, 0) to (0.051, 0.6298) - Line 3: (0.051, 0.6298) to (0, 0.6298) - Line 4: (0, 0.6298) to (0, 0) 5. Close the sketch. 6. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6298. 7. Perform a cut extrusion along the negative Z-axis by 0.0489 units. This will create a step in the prism. These instructions will result in the creation of the described 3D rectangular prism with a sloped side, centered on a white background. The length, width, and height of each part, as well as the final shape, are considered in the instructions provided.</description>
